results.adx_keywords: Long Covid;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.title: More than 1 in 5 adult Covid survivors in the U.S. may develop long Covid, a C.D.C. study suggests.
results.abstract: Researchers identified lasting health problems in many different organ systems, including the heart, lungs and kidneys.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: John Gillotte of New York City was infected with Covid in March 2020. After being hospitalized and on a ventilator for five days, he then experienced long Covid symptoms that lasted for months.
media.copyright: Joshua Bright for The New York Times

results.byline: By Josh Katz and Wilson Andrews
results.title: How Y’all, Youse and You Guys Talk
results.abstract: What does the way you speak say about where you’re from? Answer all the questions below to see your personal dialect map.

results.adx_keywords: Shutdowns (Institutional);Baby Foods;Bacteria;United States Politics and Government;Supply Chain;Shortages;Infant Formulas;Califf, Robert M;Abbott Laboratories;Food and Drug Administration;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;Michigan
results.byline: By Christina Jewett and Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
results.title: F.D.A. Chief Details ‘Shocking’ Conditions at Baby Formula Plant
results.abstract: Agency inspectors found a leaking roof, standing water and cracked production equipment before a facility shutdown that led to major shortages.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Abbott Nutrition’s baby formula plant in Sturgis, Mich., had “egregiously unsanitary” conditions, the Food and Drug Administration commissioner, Dr. Robert Califf, told lawmakers on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Sarah Rice for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Elections, Governors;Presidential Election of 2020;Politics and Government;Frauds and Swindling;United States Politics and Government;Primaries and Caucuses;Forgery;Craig, James;Whitmer, Gretchen;Benson, Jocelyn;Johnson, Perry (1948- );Republican Party;Michigan
results.title: Two top Republicans in the Michigan governor’s race face disqualification over forged petitions, officials say.
results.abstract: The Bureau of Elections moved to exclude James Craig and Perry Johnson from the primary ballot, finding that they had failed to collect the required signatures.

media.caption: James Craig, a former Detroit police chief, had been considered a front-runner in Michigan’s Republican primary for governor.

results.adx_keywords: Transgender and Transsexuals;Education (K-12);Athletics and Sports;Law and Legislation;Vetoes (US);Youth;Holcomb, Eric (1968- );Republican Party;Indiana
results.title: Indiana Lawmakers Override Transgender Sports Veto
results.abstract: Gov. Eric Holcomb said the measure barring transgender girls from playing girls’ sports at school was unnecessary, but fellow Republicans in the Legislature disagreed.

media.caption: A rally for transgender rights at the Indiana Statehouse on Tuesday.
media.copyright: Casey Smith/Report for America, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Baptist Churches;Ministers (Protestant);Sex Crimes;Child Abuse and Neglect;Brown, Christa;Southern Baptist Convention
results.title: Southern Baptists to Release List of Ministers Accused of Sexual Abuse
results.abstract: The existence of the secretly maintained list was revealed in a bombshell report on the denomination’s handling of sexual abuse over the past two decades.

media.caption: Southern Baptists will convene for their annual meeting in mid-June and will consider the report’s findings and recommendations.

results.title: Deadliest U.S. School Shooting in Decade Shakes Rural Texas Town

media.caption: Praying outside of Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, on Wednesday.

results.byline: By Emily Cochrane and Catie Edmondson
results.title: Democrats moved quickly to clear the way for votes on legislation to strengthen background checks for gun purchasers.
results.abstract: Republicans have opposed such measures in the past, and gave no indication that they had changed their positions.

media.caption: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer during the weekly Democratic news conference on Tuesday.

results.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene wins her primary, dashing establishment G.O.P. hopes.
results.abstract: The far-right congresswoman fended off a challenge from a Republican businesswoman who had hoped to push Ms. Greene into a runoff election.

media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.title: Another Omicron subvariant, known as BA.2.12.1, has become the dominant form among new U.S. virus cases.
results.abstract: The development comes as the United States recently began averaging more than 100,000 new confirmed cases per day again, according to a New York Times database, for the first time since February.

results.adx_keywords: Reading and Writing Skills (Education);Illiteracy;Dyslexia;Education (K-12);Teachers and School Employees;Content Type: Personal Profile;Calkins, Lucy;Teachers College of Columbia University
results.title: In the Fight Over How to Teach Reading, This Guru Makes a Major Retreat
results.abstract: Lucy Calkins, a leading literacy expert, has rewritten her curriculum to include a fuller embrace of phonics and the science of reading. Critics may not be appeased.

media.caption: Lucy Calkins, an education professor, created a popular curriculum called “Units of Study,” built on a vision of children as natural readers and writers.
media.copyright: Evelyn Freja for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Domestic Violence;Libel and Slander;Depp, Johnny;Heard, Amber;Moss, Kate;Washington Post
results.title: Kate Moss Denies Johnny Depp Pushed Her Down Stairs in Testimony
results.abstract: Appearing as a witness for Mr. Depp, whom she dated in the 1990s, the British model countered testimony by the actor’s ex-wife, Amber Heard, who had alluded to a rumored incident between them.

media.caption: Kate Moss, a former girlfriend of Johnny Depp, testified via a video link at the libel trial involving Mr. Depp and his ex-wife Amber Heard.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Governors;Elections, Senate;Elections, House of Representatives;Primaries and Caucuses;Presidential Election of 2020;Trump, Donald J;Kemp, Brian P;Perdue, David A Jr;Raffensperger, Brad;McBath, Lucy;Republican Party;Democratic Party;Georgia
results.title: Four Takeaways From Tuesday’s Elections
results.abstract: Georgia voters rejected Donald Trump’s 2020 fixation, G.O.P. governors proved their strength, and Georgia Democrats backed a gun-control champion on the day of a horrifying school shooting in Texas.

media.caption: Gov. Brian Kemp’s watch party on Tuesday night in Atlanta. He crushed his Trump-backed challenger, David Perdue, by about 50 percentage points.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.title: A teacher who was killed cared for her students like her own children.
results.abstract: Grieving family members have begun to share the names of the victims from Tuesday’s shooting. Police officers have yet to release a list.

media.caption: A prayer vigil in Uvalde’s town square on Tuesday.

results.title: Debunking 3 Viral Rumors About the Texas Shooting
results.abstract: False and unfounded claims started to spread online shortly after the killings.

results.byline: By Farnaz Fassihi and Ronen Bergman
results.title: Israel Tells U.S. It Killed Iranian Officer, Official Says
results.abstract: Israeli officials say the officer, Sayad Khodayee, was a leader of a covert unit tasked with abductions and killings of Israelis and other foreigners around the world. Iran does not acknowledge that the unit exists.

media.caption: The funeral of Sayad Khodayee, a colonel in Iran’s Revolutionary Guards Corps, in Tehran on Tuesday.
media.copyright: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Law and Legislation;Abortion;Roe v Wade (Supreme Court Decision);Stitt, Kevin;Oklahoma
results.byline: By Luke Vander Ploeg and Kate Zernike
results.title: Oklahoma Governor Signs Bill That Bans Most Abortions
results.abstract: The law prohibits abortion at the point of fertilization, and relies on civilian enforcement to sidestep Roe v. Wade.

media.caption: Gov. Kevin Stitt of Oklahoma in April after signing a bill that makes it a felony to perform an abortion after six weeks of pregnancy.

results.adx_keywords: Student Loans;Colleges and Universities;Credit and Debt;Personal Finances;Consumer Protection;Debt Collection;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Education Department (US)
results.title: 7 Million Bad Student Loans With No Way Out, for Anyone
results.abstract: The Biden administration plans to offer those with loans in default a fresh start. It would help borrowers and the government alike.

results.byline: By Paul Mozur and John Liu
results.title: China is organizing military drills near Taiwan in a warning to the U.S.
results.abstract: After President Biden suggested the United States would get involved militarily to defend Taiwan if China attacked it, China described organizing combat drills in the seas and airspace around Taiwan.

media.caption: A view of the South China Sea between the city of Xiamen in China, in the far distance, and the islands of Kinmen in Taiwan, in the foreground.

results.byline: By Jack Healy and Edgar Sandoval
results.title: ‘Why the Kids?’ In Close-Knit Uvalde, It’s Everyone’s Loss.
results.abstract: In Uvalde, Texas, where 19 children and two teachers were killed, everyone, it seemed, had a connection to those lost.

media.caption: A family prayed before leaving flowers near the entrance of Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Ivan Pierre Aguirre for The New York Times
